newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore's SRC restarts 90,000-bpd CDU on Mar 23.
newsitem.headline: Singapore's SRC restarts 90,000-bpd CDU on Mar 23.

text.p: Singapore Refining Co has restarted a 90,000-barrel-per-day (bpd) crude distillation unit on March 23 after a scheduled 19-day turnaround, a company spokesman said.
"It was up yesterday," the spokesman said.
SRC has a total refining capacity of 280,000-bpd at its Pulau Merlimau refinery, off southwest Singapore.
The company is jointly owned by Singapore Petroleum Co, British Petroleum and Caltex, itself a joint-venture between Texaco Inc and Chevron Corp.
